pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the void_star smart lamp system, explaining the two-device architecture (ESP32 lamp + ESP8266 sensor), their purpose, and how they work together to create an adaptive ambient lighting solution

pages.title: System Architecture
pages.purpose: Document the high-level architecture showing how the ESP32 lamp, ESP8266 sensor, and web interface interact, including communication protocols and network topology

pages.title: ESP-NOW Communication Protocol
pages.purpose: Explain how ESP-NOW enables low-latency wireless communication between the sensor node and lamp, including packet structure, broadcasting, and reliability mechanisms

pages.title: WiFi Network Modes
pages.purpose: Document the dual WiFi operating modes (AP and STA) for both devices, explaining when to use each mode and how they affect system operation

pages.title: ESP32 Sleep Lamp
pages.purpose: Comprehensive documentation of the main ESP32 device, covering its firmware architecture, hardware interfaces, and core functionality

pages.title: Main Firmware Architecture
pages.purpose: Detail the ESP32 firmware structure, including initialization sequence, main loop operation, event handling, and module integration

pages.title: LED Control System
pages.purpose: Document the LED control subsystem that manages WS2812B strip operation, including effects, colors, and brightness management

pages.title: WS2812FX Integration
pages.purpose: Explain how the system integrates with the WS2812FX library for LED effects, including the 56 available lighting patterns and how they're controlled

pages.title: REST API Reference
pages.purpose: Complete reference documentation for all REST API endpoints including parameters, responses, and example usage

pages.purpose: Document all configuration parameters defined in config.h, including hardware pin assignments, default values, and WiFi credentials

pages.title: Filesystem Management
pages.purpose: Explain the LittleFS filesystem abstraction layer and how it's used to serve static web assets

pages.title: Firmware Architecture
pages.purpose: Detail the ESP8266 firmware structure, including initialization, main loop, sensor reading cycle, and ESP-NOW transmission

pages.title: BH1750 Light Sensor Integration
pages.purpose: Explain how the firmware interfaces with the BH1750 ambient light sensor via I2C, including addressing and measurement modes

pages.title: ESP-NOW Broadcasting and Reliability
pages.purpose: Document the ESP-NOW transmission implementation, including packet structure, broadcast addressing, failure tracking, and automatic recovery

pages.title: Configuration Web Interface
pages.purpose: Explain the embedded web server that allows users to configure the sensor's ESP-NOW channel for broadcast or pairing modes

pages.title: Web User Interface
pages.purpose: Document the browser-based control panel for managing lamp settings, monitoring status, and configuring network options

pages.title: Frontend Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain the single-page application architecture, including HTML structure, JavaScript organization, and API communication patterns

pages.title: Development Guide
pages.purpose: Resources for developers who want to build, modify, or extend the void_star system

pages.purpose: Explain the development tools required (Arduino IDE for hardware, VS Code for Webpage) and how to configure the build environment based on .gitignore contents

pages.title: Hardware Requirements
pages.purpose: List all required hardware components including ESP32/ESP8266 boards, WS2812B LED strip, BH1750 sensor, and wiring diagrams

pages.purpose: Document all compile-time and runtime configuration options, including how to customize defaults, tune the Mimir algorithm, and adjust system parameters
